documents.document:
Andros Trophy: Pas de la Casa

Opening Dates: December 13, 2008 - December 14, 2008

Location: Ax-les-Thermes, France

France’s premier ice-racing series stages its second race of the season at Pas de la Casa, one of Andorra’s most modern resorts. It is the most famous trophy in the France ‘Andorra’. It is Held at Pas de la casa Andorra France on December 13, 2008 - December 14, 2008.

A glamorous and spectacular event, the Andros Trophy has been running since 1990. Attracting big name drivers and manufacturers, it consists of seven races in mountain resorts, with a grand finale pitting the leaders against each other.

The ice track on which the race is run is prepared weeks in advance, being ritually sprayed with water to ensure an even and stable coating of ice. However, the often capricious weather conditions make for exciting viewing when ice melts or forms.

The race itself is fought in two categories, Elite and Promotion, each of which are split into two heats. Driver and co-pilot teams are divided into two groups for both heats and finals, guaranteeing more races for onlookers. The winning team is the one with the most points after the finals.

We recommend you book your package at least 30 days before the date of Andros Trophy. Please check out our special offers for Andros Trophy at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Passes of the Andros Trophy, Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy the Andros Trophy!

Argentinean Open Polo Tournament

Date: 15 Nov - 6 Dec 2008; Weekends only (annual)

Where: Campo Argentino de Polo en Palermo

The fifth-oldest polo competition in the world, the Argentinian Open Polo Tournament was first played in 1893. Held at the Campo Argentino de Polo in Palermo, it is an exciting spectacle and an unmissable occasion for people-watching.

Argentinean Open Polo Tournament is Started on 15 Nov - 6 Dec 2008; Weekends only (annual) at Campo Argentino de Polo en Palermo Argentina.

We recommend you book your package at least 30 days before the date of Argentinean Open Polo Tournament. Please check out our special offers for Argentinean Open Polo Tournament at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Passes of the Argentinean Open Polo Tournament, Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy the Argentinean Open Polo Tournament!

Fuse New Year’s Eve Party

When: Dec 2008 (annual)

Where: Fuse, Brussels, Belgium

Opening Hours: 11pm-7am

Guaranteed to be a top night out, Fuse’s New Year’s Eve party sees guest DJ Technician and Oliver Ho (aka Raudive) join residents Deg, Pierre and St Dic for a full-on night of house and techno.

Expect deep house and tech house from St Dic, hypno-house and funky techno from Deg, all mixed in with textured drums and sampling from Oliver Ho and electronica from Technician.

Fuse has been Brussels’ premier techno and house club since it opened its doors in 1994. Featuring the most innovative DJs on the scene, the club hosts some hardcore parties and events throughout the year.

We recommend you book your package at least 30 days before the date of Fuse New Year’s Eve Party Please check out our special offers for Fuse New Year’s Eve Party at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy the Fuse New Year’s Eve Party!

Mechelen Christmas Market

When: Dec 2008 (annual)

Where: Grote Market, Antwerp, Belgium

Opening Hours: Fri 2pm-10am; Sat 10am-10pm; Sun 10am-8pm

The Grote Markt (Market Square) in the centre of Mechelen hosts a three-day Christmas market every December. Visitors can stock up on decorations and sip some gluhwein under the Christmas tree.

There are carol concerts in the evening, while stalls sell special Christmas foods, records, books, clothes, antiques and more. The large square by Europe’s tallest Gothic church is always packed, so don’t miss out on the festive atmosphere if you’re nearby.

It is the opportunity to purchase some gifts on this Christmas & New Year. You can purchase gifts at reasonable price from Mechelen Christmas Market, Belgium. This market is open at Fri 2pm-10am; Sat 10am-10pm; Sun 10am-8pm.

We recommend you book your package at least 20 days before the date of Mechelen Christmas Market Please check out our special offers for Mechelen Christmas Market at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy the Mechelen Christmas Market!

Modo Bruxellae Designer Sale

When: Dec 2008 (annual)

Where: Beursschouwburg

Opening Hours: Fri 12pm-9pm; Sat 10.30am-6.30pm

Dedicated fashion followers flock to Brussels’ Beursschouwburg to bag a bargain at the huge Modo Bruxellae designer sale. Now there really is no excuse for not having something to wear!

Young Belgian fashion designers sell their one-off creations at reduced prices during this two-day shopping frenzy. The designer wear on display generally includes pieces by Azniv Afsar, Caroline Foulon, Eric Beauduin, Max & Lola, Sur ta tête, Tomoko Furusawa and Xavier Gigot.

It the best opportunity to purchase well designed dresses which are designed by famous designers. You get it on reduced prices. It is open on Fri 12pm-9pm & Sat 10.30am-6.30pm at Beursschouwburg.

We recommend you book your package at least 20 days before the date of Modo Bruxellae Designer Sale Please check out our special offers for Modo Bruxellae Designer Sale at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy the Modo Bruxellae Designer Sale!

Toy Party

When: Dec 2008 (annual)

Where: Center Culturel de Joli Bois

Opening Hours: Sat 1pm-6pm; Sun 10am-6pm

Brussels’ Center Culturel de Joli Bois takes a step back in time this December and gives kids the chance to get to grips with some good old-fashioned toys.

Farewell Play Station, bye-bye i Pod. This nostalgic two-day event brings the magic of real toys to life and explores the secret behind games that have delighted children for centuries.

The hands-on exhibition displays an extensive range of toys from different eras. From classic train sets, remote control cars and tin soldiers through to magic lanterns, View masters, building bricks and yo-yos, it should keep little minds and restless fingers busy.

This is very good opportunity for children who play with toys. They get old-fashioned & real toys on cheapest cost. This Toy Party is held in Dec 2008 & opening hours: Sat 1pm-6pm & Sun 10am-6pm.

We recommend you book your package at least 10 days before the date of Toy Party Belgium Please check out our special offers for Toy Party Belgium at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy Toy Party Belgium!

Vienna Philharmonic´s New Year’s Day Concert

When: 1 Jan 2009 (annual)

Where: Musikverein

Opening Hours: 11.15am

One of the world’s most famous concerts, the Vienna Philharmonic’s New Year’s Day Concert in the Musikverein’s fabulous Golden Hall greets the New Year with dance music of the Strauss dynasty.

The History of the Vienna Philharmonic´s New Year’s Concert

The Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra’s New Year’s Concert is by far the most popular of this orchestra’s functions, but also Austria’s most noteworthy cultural export. Throughout the world the Vienna Philharmonic’s New Year’s Concert is televised worldwide and is without doubt the most widely seen and heard of all regular musical presentations performed in the equally famous Musikvervein Concert Hall.

Herbert von Karajan conducted in 1987 (an experience which he reported was completely rejuvenative for his music-making), since when the baton has changed hands annually between a small number of top maestros: Abbado, Kleiber, Maazel, Mehta, Muti, Harnoncourt (the first Viennese conductor since 1980 to take the baton, in 2001 and again in 2003), Ozawa, Jansons and - in 2008 - the sprightly octogenarian, French conductor Georges Pretre making his New Year Concert debut.

Special Attractions

In 2009 another debutant, Daniel Barenboim, guides the Philharmonic through favourite Strauss dances, as well as their contemporaries, ending with the traditional encores - the Blue Danube waltz and Johann Strauss the Elder’s Radetzky march.

Online Bookings

We recommend you book your package at least 30 days before the date of New Vienna Philharmonic´s New Year’s Concert. Please check out our special offers for Vienna Philharmonic´s New Year’s Concert at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy the Vienna Philharmonic´s New Year’s concert!

New Year’s Junkanoo

When: 1 Jan 2009 (annual)

Where: Bay Street

Opening Hours: From 2am

Nassau’s Bay Street lights up each year for Junkanoo - an adrenalin rush of colours, costumes and floats driven by the beat of the goatskin drum.

This is a festival unique for its raw Afro-Caribbean flavour. Spectators line Bay Street from about 2am until 8am. A mounting clamour of bells, whistles and goombay drums throbs forward to the rhythm of the music until dawn streaks across the sky, revealing revellers in extraordinary costumes.

Special Attraction

Secret Junkanoo “shacks” all over the island are the venues for the creation of these costumes, made of thousands of tiny pieces of coloured paper. Competition to win is always fierce. The groups who compete in the Junkanoo have crazy names such as the Vikings, the Music Makers and the Z-Bandits. The winners are announced on the local radio and television stations and there is a cash prize for the winning group.

Online Bookings

We recommend you book your package at least 30 days before the date of New Year’s Junkanoo. Please check out our special offers for New Year’s Junkanoo at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy New Year’s Junkanoo!

The Dakar rally

When: 3 - 18 Jan 2009 (annual)

Where: Buenos Aires

The Dakar Rally pits over 400 drivers against each other in a gruelling long-distance race. In 2009, the rally takes place in South America for the first time, covering a 9000km loop between Buenos Aires, Argentina and Valparaíso, Chile.

Competitors from around the world drive a mixture of buggies, 4×4 vehicles, motorbikes and quad-bikes, but only a quarter of participants can expect to finish. The lucky few cover landscapes ranging from mountains to desert and farmland and contrasting extremes of heat and cold.

The event began in 1977 and creates more and more press attention, entrants and excitement every year.

We recommend you book your package at least 30 days before the date of The Dakar Rally Argentina. Please check out our special offers for The Dakar Rally Argentina at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy The Dakar Rally Argentina!

Aruba’s International Pro-Am Golf Tournament

When: Aug 2009
Where: Tierra Del Sol Resort and Golf Course

Aruba’s International Pro-Am Golf Tournament is held at the luxurious Tierra Del Sol Resort and Golf Course. Teams comprised of one professional and four amateur golfers compete in the 36-hole event.

We recommend you book your package at least 3 months before the date of Golf Tournament. Please check out our special offers for Aruba’s International Pro-Am Golf Tournament at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Come and enjoy Aruba’s International Pro-Am Golf Tournament!

Abu Simbel Festival

When: Feb 2009

Where: Abu Simbel Temple

Opening Hours: Sunrise

During the Abu Simbel Festival crowds fill the temple at sunrise to watch the shafts of light slowly creeping through the stone, illuminating the statues of Ramses, Ra and Amun and providing a spectacular sight.

It was Ramses II who, in a fit of precision and architectural egotism, carefully angled his temple at Abu Simbel so that the inner sanctum would light up twice a year - once on the anniversary of his rise to the throne, and once on his birthday. Impressively, it is only the inner sanctum that lights up, while the statute of Ptah (the god of darkness) remains in the shadows.

When they have recovered their breath, visitors can join celebrations outside, including a fair and music demonstrations. However, nothing can really impress you immediately after witnessing such a sight.

When the Aswan Dam caused the Nasser Lake to rise and inundate the area in the early 1960s, the entire temple was moved to higher ground and for this reason the sun now strikes a day later than Ramses had originally planned.

We recommend you book your package at least 2 months before the date of Abu Simbel Festival. Please check out our special offers for Abu Simbel Festival at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy Abu Simbel Festival!

Bohemian Carnival

When: 13 - 24 Feb 2009

Where: Prague

Held at venues in the heart of the city centre, Prague’s Bohemian Carnival offers a lot more than costumes and street parades. A great programme of events, divided into four sections, entertains both children and adults.

Starting with Salón at Clam-Gallas, which features Camera Carnevale, a photographic studio, Boudoir, a carnival dressing room, and Grand Table, entailing a presentation by the Prague Regional Association of Cooks and Confectioners, the Bohemian Carnival moves on to Galactico, a series of evening parties and art shows for the grown-ups.

Cuisine d’Alchimiste is the Bohemian Carnival’s food feast, taking place at several restaurants, while Divertimento Furioso is a series of parades. Taking to the streets of Prague in 2009 are ancient masks from Sardinia, a parade of allegorical prams and Candelion - Grand Defilé, a spectacular street event with lanterns and masks concluding this edition.

We recommend you book your package at least 2 months before the date of Bohemian Carnival. Please check out our special offers for Bohemian Carnival at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy Bohemian Carnival!

Children’s Theatre Festival

When: Apr 2009

Where: Naestved

The town of Naestved is this year’s host for the world’s largest festival of professional theatre for children and young people. Around 90 Danish professional theatre groups present more than 450 shows in a single week.

We recommend you book your package at least 2 months before the date of Children’s Theatre Festival. Please check out our special offers for Children’s Theatre Festival at website http://calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy Children’s Theatre Festival!

Dominica Dive Fest

When: Jun - Jul 2009

Where: Anchorage Hotel & Dive Centre

Dominica boasts the most spectacular diving sites in the world. It is only fitting that the island has a festival centred around the Anchorage Hotel in Roseau, dedicated to the sport.

Now in its seventh year, Dive Fest is a week-long event geared primarily to introducing Dominicans to the world of diving. However, everyone from divers and kayakers to snorkellers and whale watchers can participate.

Dive Fest is organized by the Dominica Watersports Association (DWA) and all funds generated from the event are used to ensure that the island has world-class watersports facilities. All activities are sponsored by various companies, some of whom are part of the DWA.

Dominica is considered the “nature” island of the Caribbean because of its spectacular topography, flora and fauna. This extends to beneath the sea. Divers are greeted with a rich assortment of colorful sponges, an abundance of crinoids, camouflaged frogfish, arrow crabs, anemones with cleaner shrimp of every kind hiding inside them, walls covered in black coral and gorgonians with the occasional sea horse attached. There are caves full of lobster, dramatic arches of coral-covered granite, and schools of sennet, large Southern stingrays, big barracuda and schools of baitfish being pursued by various jacks.

Dive Fest begins with a dinner and booze cruise and provided you don’t have a hangover in the days to follow you can enjoy scuba diving, snorkelling, kayaking, swimming and an underwater treasure hunt. There will also be non-aquatic events such as a fashion show and a beach barbecue. For those who prefer nocturnal activities, there will be nightly events. The festival ends with awards and thanksgiving service and a huge beach party on Soufriere beach.

We recommend you book your package at least 3 months before the date of Dominica Dive Fest. Please check out our special offers for Dominica Dive Fest at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy Dominica Dive Fest!

Easter Week in Quito

When: 5 - 12 Apr 2009

Where: Old Town

One of the unmissable celebrations during Holy Week in Quito is on Good Friday. There is a spectacular procession through the old city that charts the events of Christ’s Passion, complete with effigies of Christ and the Virgin Mary.

Devotees (members of religious guilds), dressed in purple tunics with matching cone-shaped hoods, lead the procession. The pageant also depicts Romans whipping penitents, who bear large crosses on their shoulders which they must carry along the entire route.

We recommend you book your package at least 2 months before the date of Easter Week in Quito. Please check out our special offers for Easter Week in Quito at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Festival of Dominican Song Eduardo Brito

When: Jun 2009

Where: National Theatre

Not scheduled to happen in 2008, the Festival of Dominican Song Eduardo Brito (Festival de la Cancion Dominican Eduardo Brito) is named after the famous Dominican baritone and usually takes place in the National Theatre.

The festival aims to encourage composition among Dominicans and is broadcast live over radio and television on both nights. Contestants must be between 17 and 50 years old and the winner skips home with the grand prize of one million pesos and a sparkling trophy.

We recommend you book your package at least 2 months before the date of Festival. Please check out our special offers for Festival at website http://calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy Festival!

FIS Women's Alpine Skiing World Cup: Spindleruv Mlyn

When: 3 - 4 Jan 2009

Where: Spindleruv Mlyn

The world’s top female skiers visit Spindleruv Mlyn in the Czech Republic for giant slalom and slalom events in the Alpine Skiing World Cup.

The Alpine Skiing World Cup is the most glamorous event of its kind. The competitors travel the world to premier ski resorts, gathering points as they go. There are separate awards for the individual disciplines, but the Holy Grail is the title of Alpine World Cup Overall Champion.

The tournament is divided into the Ladies’ and Men’s events, often held in different locations. The individual disciplines of the Alpine Skiing World Cup, for both sexes, are Downhill, Slalom, Giant Slalom, Super G and Combined, ensuring that every attribute of modern skiing technique is thoroughly tested. To win the combined title is the mark of a truly accomplished skier.

We recommend you book your package at least 2 months before the date of Skiing World Cup. Please check out our special offers for Skiing World Cup at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy Skiing World Cup!

Fruit and Flower Festival

When: Jan - Feb 2009

Where: Ambato

Ambato is commonly dubbed Ecuador’s “garden city” and the annual Fruit and Flower Festival, Fiesta de la Fruta y de las Flores, is a perfect reminder of this nickname and takes place in various locations throughout the city.

The month of February bursts at the seams with a variety of music, dance and sports events to celebrate the yearly Fruit and Flower Festival, where the locals traditionally attend a blessing given to the fruit and flowers in the cathedral.

Unmissable are the mariachi festival; the athletic running race through the city streets; the coronation of the Queen of Ambato; the National Cowboy Parade (Desfile National Chacarero) on the first day and of course the all-important Fruit and Flower Parade.

We recommend you book your package at least 2 months before the date of Fruit and Flower Festival. Please check out our special offers for Fruit and Flower Festival at website http://calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy Fruit and Flower Festival!

Guaranda Carnival

When: Feb 2008

Where: Guaranda

The yearly Guaranda Carnival is known to be one of the best in Ecuador and is eagerly anticipated by the bolivarenses, the people from the Bolívar province.

Although the once traditional throwing of water and flour balloons over fellow revellers has now been deemed too dangerous and finally banned, the locals still manage to thoroughly entertain themselves with much singing and dancing in the streets.

The carnival features the important choosing of the Kuski Raymi Ñusta (meaning “pretty woman” and referring to the carnival queen), and the recurring presence of Taita Carnival and Mama Carnival as the two male and female carnival characters who preside over the parades and festivities.

In the run-up to carnival pigs, chickens and rabbits are fattened and killed in order for the best local dishes to be made for the celebrations, washed down with copious amounts of the local Guaranda spirit Pájaro Azul (Blue Bird).

We recommend you book your package at least 2 months before the date of Guaranda Carnival. Please check out our special offers for Guaranda Carnival at website http://calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy Guaranda Carnival!

International Festival of Wind Orchestras

When: 3 - 4 Jan 2009

Where: Prague

Amateur orchestras from around the world classify themselves into middle, higher or top classes for the International Festival of Wind Orchestras competition in Prague. The 30-minute performances are judged by Czech and European wind music experts.

The schedule includes an opening concert of the Orchestra of the Castle Guard and the Police of the Czech Republic, the competition of the individual categories and the highlight award ceremony on the last evening.

Orchestra types can include harmonies, fanfare orchestras or brass bands. The councilor of the City of Prague receives the orchestra representatives in the Old Town Hall. Other venues include the National House Smichov and the Congress Hall in the TOP Hotel.

We recommend you book your package at least 2 months before the date of International Festival of Wind Orchestras. Please check out our special offers for International Festival of Wind Orchestras at website www.calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy International Festival of Wind Orchestras!

World Creole Music Festival

When: Oct - Nov 2009

Where: Roseau

The annual World Creole Music Festival in Rouseau brings together musicians, singers and bands from all over the Caribbean and features the unique rhythms of zouk, zydeco, cadence, compas and soukous.

Dominica lies between the French islands of Martinique and Guadeloupe. Interestingly, it is an English-speaking island that was once a colony of Britain. However, the country’s culture and language is strongly tinged by the French creole influences that emanate from its neighbours, which is reflected in the music. Though other island rhythms such as calypso and reggae are popular, zouk and zydeco - spicy, fast-paced, French Creole music - are preferred.

Zouk and zydeco, along with soukous, a modern Zairean dance music, salsa, cadence and compas from Haiti, are all featured during the event, with performers from Cuba, Africa, Haiti and Dominica, among others.

We recommend you book your package at least 2 months before the date of Music Festival. Please check out our special offers for Music Festival at website http://calculatemytrip.com.

Calculate My Trip also provide you Holiday packages, Air tickets, Hotel Bookings, etc. at cheapest cost.

Come and enjoy Music Festival!
